TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MultipartSigned extends MimeKit.Multipart

Docs.summary: A signed multipart, as used by both S/MIME and PGP/MIME protocols.
Docs.remarks: The first child of a multipart/signed is the content while the second child is the detached signature data. Any other children are not defined and could be anything.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class MimeKit.MimeEntityConstructorInfo entity) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MimeKit.Cryptography.MultipartSigned Create (MimeKit.Cryptography.CmsSigner signer, MimeKit.MimeEntity entity);
.method public static hidebysig class MimeKit.Cryptography.MultipartSigned Create(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CmsSigner signer, class MimeKit.MimeEntity entity) cil managed

Docs.remarks: Cryptographically signs the entity using the supplied signer in order to generate a detached signature and then adds the entity along with the detached signature data to a new multipart/signed part.
Docs.exception: A cryptography context suitable for signing could not be found.
An error occurred in the cryptographic message syntax subsystem.

Docs.param: The S/MIME context to use for signing.
Docs.remarks: Cryptographically signs the entity using the supplied signer in order to generate a detached signature and then adds the entity along with the detached signature data to a new multipart/signed part.
Docs.exception: An error occurred in the cryptographic message syntax subsystem.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MimeKit.Cryptography.MultipartSigned Create (Org.BouncyCastle.Bcpg.OpenPgp.PgpSecretKey signer, MimeKit.Cryptography.DigestAlgorithm digestAlgo, MimeKit.MimeEntity entity);

Docs.param: The digest algorithm to use for signing.
Docs.remarks: Cryptographically signs the entity using the supplied signer and digest algorithm in order to generate a detached signature and then adds the entity along with the detached signature data to a new multipart/signed part.
Docs.exception: cannot be used for signing.
The was out of range.

exception.para: A cryptography context suitable for signing could not be found.

Docs.exception: An error occurred in the OpenPGP subsystem.
